The Gödelization of formulas now follows the usual, recursion pattern:

children.html: ⌜x=y⌝=(3,(⌜x⌝,⌜y⌝))⌜x∈y⌝=(4,(⌜x⌝,⌜y⌝))⌜¬φ⌝=(5,⌜φ⌝)⌜φ∨ψ⌝=(6,(⌜φ⌝,⌜ψ⌝))⌜∃vnφ⌝=(7,(n,⌜φ⌝))\begin{align*} \GN{x=y} & = (3, (\GN{x}, \GN{y})) \\ \GN{x\in y} & = (4, (\GN{x}, \GN{y})) \\ \GN{\neg \varphi} & = (5, \GN{\varphi}) \\ \GN{\varphi \vee \psi} & = (6, (\GN{\varphi}, \GN{\psi})) \\ \GN{\exists v_n \varphi} & = (7, (n, \GN{\varphi})) \\ \end{align*}┌x=y┐┌x∈y┐┌¬φ┐┌φ∨ψ┐┌∃vn​φ┐​=(3,(┌x┐,┌y┐))=(4,(┌x┐,┌y┐))=(5,┌φ┐)=(6,(┌φ┐,┌ψ┐))=(7,(n,┌φ┐))​
